how to clean a remote control car after use hey everyone so ive been into rc cars for a while now and one thing i learned the hard way is that cleaning your remote control car after each bash session makes a huge difference in how long it lasts i used to just toss mine in the closet covered in dirt and mud and honestly that was a mistake the gears got all gunked up and some parts started rusting not fun heres what i do now and it takes like 10 minutes tops step 1 let it cool down after driving give your rc vehicle a few minutes to chill the motor and battery get pretty hot especially if youve been running it hard step 2 remove the battery always take out the battery pack first you dont want any electrical stuff getting wet during cleaning this is super important for both electric and brushless motor cars step 3 brush off the loose dirt i use an old toothbrush or a small paintbrush to get rid of mud grass and debris pay attention to the wheels suspension and chassis get into those tight spots around the steering components and shock absorbers step 4 wipe down with a damp cloth for the body shell and plastic parts a slightly damp microfiber cloth works great dont spray water directly on the electronics or receiver box if youve got a waterproof remote control car you have a bit more freedom here but i still avoid soaking the inside parts step 5 clean the tires the tires pick up tons of rocks and dirt i usually rinse them under the sink or wipe them down good clean tires grip better on your next run step 6 check for damage while cleaning i look for loose screws wornout parts or anything broken its way easier to spot problems when everythings clean step 7 dry everything let your car air dry completely before putting the battery back in or storing it i usually leave mine out for about 30 minutes step 8 light lubrication once its dry i put a tiny bit of oil on the drivetrain and moving parts this keeps everything running smooth and prevents rust if youre looking for a quality rc car thats worth taking care of ive found some solid options here theyve got different styles whether youre into offroad bashers or speed racing taking care of your rc hobby doesnt have to be complicated a little maintenance after each use means your remote controlled vehicle will last way longer and perform better plus its kind of satisfying to see it all clean and ready for the next adventure trust me your future self will thank you when your car is still running strong months later while your buddys is falling apart and if youre in the market for a new one or want to check out whats available definitely browse through the selection at whats your cleaning routine like any tips i missed

99 ford ranger died middrive pump relay and engine clicking im completely new to diy auto care so what did i do i bought a 99 ford ranger and said i know things will break eventually itll be a good chance to learn well its been a week since i bought it and here we are my education begins sooner than i thought tldr truck stalleddied while driving was able to start up again and drive another 500 feet before it died again since then havent been able to start itll turn over but rev up and then die again when in the on position check engine light flickers in sync with the ticking sound in the video check gauges light is on steady battery light is on steady theft light is flashing quickly i dont believe this truck has the security system that requires a certain key to turn on but a code did come back with p1260 engine disabled by pats the key i have looks totally normal and i have a keyfob that locksunlocks doors the clicking in the video is coming from the fuel pump relay most noticeably and another quieter clicking somewhere down in the back middle or lower part of the engine bay as well i can hear it down by the fuel tank fuel pump as well but im assuming thats just from reverberation because its quieter i dont know how much detail i should provide so im going to provide it all in hopes it helps an expert help me vehicle details 1999 ford ranger xlt 40l v6 4x4143k miles im the 3rd owner previous owner had a few vehicles and didnt drive it as a daily driving historyinitial indicators test drive went great no issues took it to a mechanic for a presale inspection and he said it was in good shape outside of a valve cover leak and front cover crank seal leak theres definitely an oil leak with a mix of old and new oil covering the bottom half of the engine but when parked in the driveway overnight after driving for a while there were two drips about the size of a dime drove daily for a week i noticed a few days after purchasing that it would take a few seconds to turn over when i first started it up rer rer rer rer then it drove fine and started up fine the rest of the day five days ago i try to start it i had driven it an hour prior and it turns over but then cycles high rpm then low rpm then high rpm then low rpm and then stalls the lights in the video come on i think not ideal but i try again same thing try one more time and it turns over and runs fine i probably shouldve dealt with it then but ive been exceptionally busy so i figured very light use for a week or two would be fine given that was the only time that happened then three days ago im driving about a 15 minute drive and it dies middrive i try to start again and its struggling try a couple more times and it starts up and im able to get it out of the middle of the intersection to the side of the road before it dies again power steering brakes etc i had it towed back to my place where ive been doing my best to figure it out but im a bit overwhelmed more complicated diagnosis than i was hoping for my first diy attempt heres what ive investigated used a circuit tester all circuits are working fine both under the hood and by the drivers side door i visually inspected a handful as well no issues ran an obd ii diagnostic with the key in on position using forscan obviously cant scan with the engine running it came back with a number of codes but im unsure which of these are actually active and which are historic and were never cleared the guy i bought it from mentioned hed fixed a couple of things so its possible he never cleared codes hes a 50 year auto parts salesman which makes me feel both good and also slightly scared was he a knowledgeable parts guy or a just weld the hitch to the bumper guy he seemed very nice and trustworthy and im generally a good judge of character but maybe i missed this one hoping not here are the codes that came back pcm p0171 p0174 pcm 1000 gem p1808 gem p1804 gem b1483 gem p0500 gem b1359 abs c1230 abs c1102 im praying some of these are historic and have been fixed given none of the breakers popped in the power distribution box it seems odd all of these circuits would malfunction at once without impacting a single fuse or maybe thats naive my level of knowledge is based on about 1000 google searches and youtube videos built on a foundation of generally being handy around the house and not being a moron i also tested the battery charge was fine when it died tow guy checked it and it was right on the money around 12v when he arrived im assuming that means it wasnt an alternator overcharging things edit to add serpentine belt is fine as well no gauges indicated issues before it died middrive no check engine lights came on just died and now this looked at the air filter looks almost brand new checked the connection to the maf and a few other sensors and they all look fine checked all the fluid levels and condition shortly after getting it and everything looked fine brake fluid was a little dark but not alarming so what would you do next i have a running list of guesses from my internet searching and youtube vids but im kind of paralyzed by what the next best step is going to be some of the guesses for the stall start rev stall fuel mix code lead me to bad fuel pump clogged fuel filter vacuum seal issue bad maf sensor but the ticking fuel pump relay and ticking in the engine bay area the sensor failure codes are making me worry about electrical issues id really like to figure this out myself if i can both to save money and also to have some pride in being able to fix something like this and take the opportunity to learn thanks in advance happy to send any other photos or videos that would be helpful i can try to start the engine again for an example i didnt include that here because im generally trying to avoid doing that too much because i have no idea if itll make things worse

zoom into adventure the complete guide to 24v go karts is there anything better than seeing the sheer joy on your childs face as they zip around the yard in their very own rideon for many kids a go kart 24v is the ultimate upgrade from a simple push car or a slower 12v vehicle its the perfect blend of power speed and safety that feels like the real deal but with so many options on the market how do you know if a 24v model is right for your child what features should you look for and what exactly does 24v even mean this complete guide will answer all those questions and more helping you make the best choice for your little speedster what exactly is a 24v go kart lets start with the basics the 24v in a 24v go kart refers to the voltage of its battery in simple terms voltage is a measure of the electrical power the motor can use 12v go karts these are the entrylevel models perfect for younger kids ages 35 they have slower top speeds around 24 mph and work best on flat hard surfaces like pavement or patios 24v go karts this is the sweet spot these karts offer a significant power boost typically reaching speeds of 48 mph they have enough torque to handle slight inclines and rougher terrain like grass or dirt making them ideal for kids aged 59 36v 48v go karts above these are the highperformance machines designed for older kids 10 and even teens they can reach speeds of 15 mph and require a much more skillful driver click here to check the product on amazon a go kart 24v is the logical next step when your child has outgrown their first rideon but isnt quite ready for the highspeed highstakes world of gaspowered or advanced electric karts why choose a 24v go kart the pros cons deciding on the right rideon toy involves weighing the good with the bad heres a breakdown of what you can expect from a 24v model the pros perfect power balance theyre fast enough to be thrilling but not so fast that they become uncontrollable or dangerous for a beginner many models come with adjustable speed settings or a parental lock for extra peace of mind improved battery life a 24v battery generally lasts longer than a 12v one on a single charge this means more playtime and less waiting around for the charger versatility on terrain thanks to their more powerful motor a 24v gokart can handle grass gravel and small hills with ease opening up a whole world of backyard adventures they grow with your child these karts are often larger and sturdier with features like adjustable seats that can accommodate a growing child for several years click here to check the product on amazon the cons higher price point youll pay more for a 24v model than you would for a 12v one size and weight they are bigger and heavier which can make them a bit more difficult to store or transport increased supervision needed with more speed comes more responsibility active parental supervision is crucial to ensure a safe riding experience key features to look for when buying a go kart 24v ready to start shopping keep this checklist handy to find a highquality safe and fun rideon safety first this is nonnegotiable look for seat belts an essential feature on any gokart parental remote control this allows you to take over the steering and braking if your child gets into trouble its a gamechanger for peace of mind speed locklimiter a setting that lets you cap the top speed while your child is learning click here to check the product on amazon battery performance voltage amps ah you know the voltage is 24v the amphour ah rating tells you how long the battery will last look for a higher ah number eg 7ah 10ah for longer ride times charge time check how long it takes to fully charge most take between 812 hours durability and construction frame a sturdy steel or highimpact plastic frame will withstand bumps and tumbles wheelstires eva foam rubber tires offer better grip and a quieter ride than hard plastic wheels drivetrain a rearwheel drive system is preferable as it provides better traction and a more authentic gokart feel fun extra features these arent essential but they add to the excitement look for working led headlights horn sounds engine startup sounds and even an mp3 player input so they can listen to their favorite tunes click here to check the product on amazon safety tips for a fun ride owning a go kart 24v comes with the responsibility of teaching your child how to ride safely 1 always wear a helmet a properly fitted bike helmet is a must 2 choose a safe location flat open areas away from traffic pools and steep slopes are ideal 3 supervise supervise supervise never let a young child ride unsupervised 4 do a preride check before each use make sure the battery is charged the wheels are secure and the brakes are working correctly 5 establish the rules set clear boundaries for where they can and cannot go ready to choose a 24v go kart is more than just a toy its a vehicle for creating core memories building confidence and having a ton of fun in the fresh air by understanding what to look for you can invest in a model that is safe durable and guaranteed to make your child the star of the neighborhood ready to see that smile start your search for the perfect go kart 24v today and get ready for some highoctane family fun

an electric vehicle ev is a motor vehicle whose propulsion is powered fully or mostly by electricity evs encompass a wide range of transportation modes including road and rail vehicles electric boats and submersibles electric aircraft and electric spacecraft early electric vehicles first came into existence in the late 19th century when the second industrial revolution brought forth electrification and mass utilization of dc and ac electric motors using electricity was among the preferred methods for motor vehicle propulsion as it provided a level of quietness comfort and ease of operation that could not be achieved by the gasoline engine cars of the time but range anxiety due to the limited energy storage offered by contemporary battery technologies hindered any mass adoption of private electric vehicles throughout the 20th century internal combustion engines both gasoline and diesel engines were the dominant propulsion mechanisms for cars and trucks for about 100 years but electricitypowered locomotion remained commonplace in other vehicle types such as overhead linepowered mass transit vehicles like electric trains trams monorails and trolley buses as well as various small lowspeed shortrange batterypowered personal vehicles such as mobility scooters plugin hybrid electric vehicles use electric motors as the primary propulsion method rather than as a supplement and did not see any mass production until the late 2000s and battery electric cars did not become practical options for the consumer market until the 2010s progress in batteries electric motors and power electronics has made electric cars more feasible than during the 20th century as a means of reducing tailpipe emissions of carbon dioxide and other pollutants and to reduce the use of fossil fuels government incentives are available in many areas to promote the adoption of electric cars history electric motive power started in 1827 when hungarian priest nyos jedlik built the first rudimentary yet functional electric motor the next year he used it to power a small model car in 1835 professor sibrandus stratingh of the university of groningen in the netherlands built a miniature electric vehicle car and sometime between 1832 and 1839 robert anderson of scotland invented the first crude electric carriage powered by nonrechargeable primary cells american blacksmith and inventor thomas davenport built a toy electric locomotive powered by a primitive electric motor in 1835 in 1838 a scotsman named robert davidson built an electric locomotive that attained a speed of four miles per hour 6 kmh in england a patent was granted in 1840 for the use of rails as conductors of electric current and similar american patents were issued to lilley and colten in 1847 the first massproduced electric vehicles appeared in america in the early 1900s in 1902 the studebaker automobile company entered the automotive business with electric vehicles though it also entered the gasoline vehicles market in 1904 however with the advent of cheap assembly line cars by ford motor company the popularity of electric cars declined significantly due to a lack of electricity grids and the limitations of storage batteries at that time electric cars did not gain much popularity however electric trains gained immense popularity due to their economies and achievable speeds by the 20th century electric rail transport became commonplace due to advances in the development of electric locomotives over time the generalpurpose commercial use of electric cars was reduced to specialist roles as platform trucks forklift trucks ambulances tow tractors and urban delivery vehicles such as the iconic british milk float for most of the 20th century the uk was the worlds largest user of electric road vehicles electrified trains were used for coal transport as the motors did not use the valuable oxygen in the mines switzerlands lack of natural fossil resources forced the rapid electrification of their rail network one of the earliest rechargeable batteries the nickeliron battery was favored by edison for use in electric cars evs were among the earliest automobiles and before the preeminence of light powerful internal combustion engines ices electric automobiles held many vehicle land speed and distance records in the early 1900s they were produced by baker electric columbia electric detroit electric and others and at one point in history outsold gasolinepowered vehicles in 1900 28 percent of the cars on the road in the us were electric evs were so popular that even president woodrow wilson and his secret service agents toured washington dc in their milburn electrics which covered 6070 miles 100110 km per charge most producers of passenger cars opted for gasoline cars in the first decade of the 20th century but electric trucks were an established niche well into the 1920s several developments contributed to a decline in the popularity of electric cars improved road infrastructure required a greater range than that offered by electric cars and the discovery of large reserves of petroleum in texas oklahoma and california led to the wide availability of affordable gasolinepetrol making internal combustion powered cars cheaper to operate over long distances electric vehicles were seldom marketed as womens luxury car which may have been a stigma among male consumers also internal combustionpowered cars became evereasier to operate thanks to the invention of the electric starter by charles kettering in 1912 which eliminated the need of a hand crank for starting a gasoline engine and the noise emitted by ice cars became more bearable thanks to the use of the muffler which hiram percy maxim had invented in 1897 as roads were improved outside urban areas the electric vehicle range could not compete with the ice finally the initiation of mass production of gasolinepowered vehicles by henry ford in 1913 significantly reduced the cost of gasoline cars as compared to electric cars in the 1930s national city lines which was a partnership of general motors firestone and standard oil of california purchased many electric tram networks across the country to dismantle them and replace them with gm buses the partnership was convicted of conspiring to monopolize the sale of equipment and supplies to their subsidiary companies still it was acquitted of conspiring to monopolize the provision of transportation services the copenhagen summit conducted amid a severe observable climate change brought on by humanmade greenhouse gas emissions was held in 2009 during the summit more than 70 countries developed plans to reach net zero eventually for many countries adopting more evs will help reduce the use of gasoline in recent years the market for electric offroad motorcycles including dirt bikes has seen significant growth this trend is driven by advancements in battery technology and increasing demand for recreational electric vehicles experimentation in january 1990 general motors president introduced its ev concept twoseater the impact at the los angeles auto show that september the california air resources board mandated majorautomaker sales of evs in phases starting in 1998 from 1996 to 1998 gm produced 1117 ev1s 800 of which were made available through threeyear leases chrysler ford gm honda and toyota also produced limited numbers of evs for california drivers during this period in 2003 upon the expiration of gms ev1 leases gm discontinued them the discontinuation has variously been attributed to the auto industrys successful federal court challenge to californias zeroemissions vehicle mandate a federal regulation requiring gm to produce and maintain spare parts for the few thousand ev1s and the success of the oil and auto industries media campaign to reduce public acceptance of evs a movie made on the subject in 20052006 was titled who killed the electric car and released theatrically by sony pictures classics in 2006 the film explores the roles of automobile manufacturers oil industry the us government batteries hydrogen vehicles and the general public and each of their roles in limiting the deployment and adoption of this technology ford released a number of their ford ecostar delivery vans into the market honda nissan and toyota also repossessed and crushed most of their evs which like the gm ev1s had been available only by closedend lease after public protests toyota sold 200 of its rav4 evs they later sold at over their original fortythousanddollar price later bmw of canada sold off a number of mini evs when their canadian testing ended the production of the citron berlingo electrique stopped in september 2005 zenn started production in 2006 but ended by 2009 reintroduction during the late 20th and early 21st century the environmental impact of the petroleumbased transportation infrastructure along with the fear of peak oil led to renewed interest in electric transportation infrastructure evs differ from fossil fuelpowered vehicles in that the electricity they consume can be generated from a wide range of sources including fossil fuels nuclear power and renewables such as solar power and wind power or any combination of those recent advancements in battery technology and charging infrastructure have addressed many of the earlier barriers to motor the power of a vehicles electric motor as in other machines is measured in kilowatts kw electric motors can deliver their maximum torque over a wide rpm range this means that the performance of a vehicle with a 100 kw electric motor exceeds that of a vehicle with a 100 kw internal combustion engine which can only deliver its maximum torque within a limited range of engine speed efficiency of charging varies considerably depending on the type of charger and energy is lost during the process of converting the electrical energy to mechanical energy usually direct current dc electricity is cars dc motors are often used in some cases universal motors are used and then ac or dc may be employed in recent production vehicles various motor types have been implemented for instance induction directly against a special matched track these linear motors are used in maglev trains which float above the rails supported by magnetic levitation this allows for almost no rolling resistance of the vehicle and no mechanical wear and tear of the train or track in addition to the highperformance control systems needed switching and curving of the tracks becomes difficult with linear motors which to date has restricted their operations to highspeed point to point services electric traction allows the use of regenerative braking in which the motors are used as brakes and become generators that transform the motion of usually a train into electrical power that is then fed back into the lines this system is particularly advantageous in mountainous operations as descending vehicles can produce a large portion of the power required for those ascending and in startandstop city use this regenerative system is only viable if the system is large enough to use the power generated by descending
